# URLFileProtection

**Structure**

Protection-level values for a URL resource key.

## Declaration

```swift
struct URLFileProtection
```

## Overview

These are values for the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URLResourceKey] key [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URLResourceKey/fileProtectionKey].

## Creating a URL File Protection Type

- **init(rawValue:)**: Creates a URL file protection type value.

## Protection levels

- **complete**: An option that instructs the system to store the file in an encrypted format on-disk that your app can’t access for reading or writing to while the device is locked or booting.
- **completeUnlessOpen**: An option that instructs the system to store the file in an encrypted format on-disk after it closes.
- **completeUntilFirstUserAuthentication**: An option that instructs the system to store the file in an encrypted format on-disk that your app can’t access until after the device boots.
- **completeWhenUserInactive**: An option that instructs the system to store the file in an encrypted format on-disk that your app can access only after device unlock and before expiration.
- **none**: An option that indicates the file has no special protections associated with it.

## Supporting Types

- **FileManager.DirectoryEnumerationOptions**: Options for enumerating the contents of directories.
- **FileManager.SearchPathDirectory**: The location of significant directories.
- **FileManager.SearchPathDomainMask**: Domain constants specifying base locations to use when you search for significant directories.
- **FileAttributeKey**: Keys in dictionaries used to get and set file attributes.
- **FileAttributeType**: Values representing a file’s type attribute.
- **FileProtectionType**: Protection level values that can be associated with a file attribute key.

## Conforms To

- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
